page.title: 15St Giles' Parish
page.content: Bowes with Gilmonby recently amalgamated with Startforth and Boldron parishes.The Vicarage at Bowes was sold off. There are plans to include the parishes of Rokeby and Brignall in plurality.No resident vicar in Bowes means a diminished place in village life for the church thus removing a focus for the community.Presently an average communicant congregation of less than 20 has to find not only a diocesan quota of Â£1400 but also the cost of maintenance,heating and lighting of the church.The present incumbent has reached retiring age and it may be difficult to appoint an appropriate replacement.The General Synod of the Church of England has discussed the possibility of replacing some clergy in rural areas with more lay readers.
